crypto.name: Cookie Encryption
crypto.desc:
Author: @awesome10billion

Can you unlock the secrets of the admin?

crypto.name: Cookie Encryption 2
crypto.desc:
Author: @awesome10billion

I have upgraded to use a post-quantum cryptosystem. No way you can break my cookies now!

crypto.name: Cryptoclock
crypto.desc:
Author: @JohnHammond

Just imagine it, the Cryptoclock!! Just like you've seen in the movies, a magical power to be able to manipulate the world's numbers across time!!

forensic.name: Puzzle Pieces
forensic.desc:
Author: Nordgaren

Well, I accidentally put the important data into a bunch of executables.

It was fine, until my cat stepped on my keyboard and renamed them all!

Can you help me recover the important data?

NOTE, the password for the archive is nahamcon-2025-ctf

misc.name: Free Flagsi
misc.desc:
Author: @John Hammond

WOW!! Look at all these free flags!!

But... wait a second... only one of them is right??

NOTE, bruteforcing flag submissions is still not permitted. I will put a "max attempts" limit on this challenge at 1:00 PM Pacific to stop participants from automating submissions. There is only one correct flag, you can find a needle in a haystack if you really know what you are looking for.

misc.name: Quartet
misc.desc:
Author: @John Hammond

Ah, a quartet is a collection of its unique and individuals parts... and together, this has all my favorite kinds of instruments!

misc.name: SSH Key Tester
misc.desc:
Author: @kkevsterrr

I've got a sweet new tool to verify that SSH keys work.

NOTE, the flag for this challenge is at /flag.txt.

misc.name: Screenshot
misc.desc:
Author: @John Hammond

Oh shoot! I accidentally took a screenshot just as I accidentally opened the dump of a flag.zip file in a text editor! Whoopsies, what a crazy accidental accident that just accidented!

Well anyway, I think I remember the password was just password!

misc.name: The Martian
misc.desc:
Author: @John Hammond

Wow, this file looks like it's from outta this world!

osint.name: Taken to School
osint.desc:
Author: @Jstith

"I was reading the news this week, and I saw that a student tried to hack a school's computer system!" a worried professor remarked to an IT employee during lunch. "I'm glad we've got people like you keeping our network safe." While Bob the IT admin appreciated the warm comment, his stomach dropped. "Dang it.. I haven't checked that firewall since we set it up months ago!".

IT has pulled a log file of potentially anomalous events detected by the new (albeit poorly tuned) network security software for your school. Based on open-sourced intelligence (OSINT), identify the anomalous entry in the file.

Each log entry contains a single line, including an MD5 hash titled eventHash.

The challenge flag is flag{MD5HASH} containing the eventHash of the anomalous entry.

pwn.name: Found Memory
pwn.desc:
Author: @WittsEnd2 @z3phyr

I have found something! But not getting anywhere.

pwn.name: Lost Memory
pwn.desc:
Author: @WittsEnd2

I am trying to remember something, but I keep forgetting.

pwn.name: The Jumps
pwn.desc:
Author: @WittsEnd2

I have been trying to find the next hop. Can you help me figure out where it is?

Files for this challenge are hosted on a Google Drive because of the large file size. https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/10qtzCJcMr9ZPkDitT-4YjdTMht-uyFGK?usp=sharing

NOTE, the flag for this challenge is in a file named just flag (i.e., no ending file extension).

rev.name: Deflation Gangster
rev.desc:
Author: @Kkevsterrr

Like American Gangster, but for other stuff.

rev.name: FlagsFlagsFlags
rev.desc:
Author: @Kkevsterrr

Did you see the strings? One of those is right, I can just feel it.

rev.name: Its Locked
rev.desc:
Author: @Kkevsterrr

This bin looks locked as a crypt to me, but I'm sure you can work some magic here.
All I know is that this came from a machine with a cryptic ID of just 'hello'.

rev.name: Noi Not againi
rev.desc:
Author: Nordgaren

Yeah, so... It's a crackme... It's in your FAVORITE language to Reverse Engineer!

Rust!

rev.name: Whats a base amongst friends
rev.desc:
Author: @Kkevsterrr

What's a base amongst friends though, really?

web.name: Talk Tuah
web.desc:
Author: @John Hammond

Guess what! You're the new Talk Tuah podcast producer!! Record, upload and manage guest episodes, and make sure the new podcast management site has its security in tip-top shape!

Download ZIP archive password is: talk-tuah
